Dating: PTOLEMY I SOTER I (not before); PTOLEMY III EUERGETES I (not after)
Name: Colossal head of royal statue
Description: The head, with the royal head-dress or Nemes, comes from a colossal royal statue. The break occurs at the neck. The face has rounded cheeks and a very strong protruding chin. The eyes are set close together and were inlaid but the inlay is now gone. The fact that the tail of the head-dress is vertical suggests this head comes from a standing figure. The head is similar to the Vienna head no. 80. Both come from over life-sized statues that should probably be dated to the early Ptolemaic Period.
